Key Arguments: The importance of free speech and opinion is fundamental to a thriving democracy.
The proposed legislation could lead to government propaganda and censorship.
Australia has thrived without censorship since the advent of the internet.
Suppressing free speech can lead to authoritarianism and tyranny.
Main Themes: Fear of government overreach and censorship
Historical lessons on the dangers of suppressing free speech
Notable Quotes: Vitality of free speech is paramount and our human/civil right.
History has taught us that when free speech and opinion are suppressed or silenced, the foundations of democracy crumble, leaving room for authoritarianism and tyranny to take hold.
